name: Name That Guitar Player Quiz | Bands and Musical Acts | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who is the now-accomplished acoustic player who was originally a keyboard player for Al Stewart?
questions.explanation:
Peter White.

	He had to borrow a guitar for his first guitar work with Al Stewart. The song he played on for Al was "On the Border".

questions.text: His first major band was ELF, where he sang and even started off playing bass for a while.  Who is it?
questions.explanation:
Ronnie James Dio.

	He later played with Blackmore's Rainbow.

questions.text: Who is the guitar great who wrote "Black Magic Woman"?
questions.explanation:
Peter Green.

	He replaced Eric Clapton with John Mayall's band. The band he founded was originally called Peter Green's Fleetwood Mac.

questions.text: Who is this German born player who moved to New Mexico and from rock to Flamenco with his band Luna Negra?
questions.explanation:
Ottmar Liebert.

	He has recorded two Christmas CDs featuring his flamenco stylings. He has had a number of Grammy nominations.

questions.text: What is the (real) name of the player famous for the red painted goatee and his untimely death while performing?
questions.explanation:
Darrell Abbott.

	He was barred from guitar contests after winning many of them in his youth. He won his first contest after practicing for only a couple of hours on his new Dean.

questions.text: Can you name the player who started his musical career at the old age of 22 and replaced David Coverdale for his first gig?
questions.explanation:
Chris Rea.

	He recovered from pancreatitis and continued to perform after being given a 50 percent chance of survival. He also returned to his first love: blues.

questions.text: Who became a rock guitar legend despite losing two fingertips on his right hand?
questions.explanation:
Tony Iommi.

	He first used homemade finger tips fashioned from melted plastic bottles though they were replaced by custom-made prostheses.

questions.text: Which player has created movie scores including "Paris, Texas" and "The Long Riders"?
questions.explanation:
Ry Cooder.

	Ry played all the slide parts in "Crossroads", the movie based on Robert Johnson. He has appeared on numerous Rolling Stones songs.

questions.text: Which guitar god played with his guitar held upside down?
questions.explanation:
Jimi Hendrix.

	He used right handed guitars restrung to left handed configuration. This contributed to his unique sound and made it difficult to copy.

questions.text: In the age of color and flash his sexy first video was shot in black and white on a black sand beach.  Who is it?
questions.explanation:
Chris Isaacs.

	He and Canadian sensation Michael Buble are close friends. He was also a boxer in his youth.
